channel.title: NPR Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Mart√≠nez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.

item.title: Trump-backed candidate wins Poland's presidential election
item.description: What does Poland's presidential election result mean for the country's place in Europe and the world? NPR's Steve Inskeep asks Polish political analyst Andrzej Bobinski.

item.title: How the iPad cured a top pianist's stage fright
item.description: Anxiety and panic attacks crippled pianist Simone Dinnerstein on stage, despite a stellar career. She shares how one common device helped her overcome the fear.

item.title: Miracle balm or cow pie? What's behind the beef tallow skincare trend
item.description: Rendered beef fat is having a moment as a viral skincare trend. TikTok influencers claim this 'natural' product is a complexion panacea. But is it? We asked skincare experts.

item.title: The future of Trump's tax and spending agenda, according to a Republican strategist
item.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with Republican strategist and former U.S. Senate staffer Ron Bonjean about the path in the Senate for President Trump's tax and spending agenda.

item.title: Senate returns to work with President Trump's budget plan in the agenda
item.description: The Senate returns to work today to pick up a multi-trillion-dollar bill that includes much of President Trump's agenda for cutting taxes and changing defense, energy and immigration policy.

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: The senate returns to work with President Trump's budget plan in the agenda, Ukraine and Russia resume peace talks just after a weekend of massive drone attacks, multiple people were attacked and burned in Boulder, Colorado, on Sunday afternoon at a vigil for Israeli hostages being held by Hamas.

item.title: People who want COVID vaccines worry about access
item.description: Some healthy pregnant women, parents of healthy kids and younger healthy adults are worried they won't be able to get vaccinated against COVID-19 because of the recent changes in access by the federal government.

item.title: Time is running out for thousands, after Trump ends their Temporary Protected Status
item.description: The Trump Administration is ending Temporary Protected Status for tens of thousands of immigrants. Many who have lived and worked in the U.S. for decades may now have to leave the country unless they find other ways to stay.

item.title: Rutabaga Toy Library lets families sign out toys a month at a time
item.description: Kids get over some toys pretty quickly. Enter the Rutabaga Toy Library, one of several similar businesses where families can sign out Tinker Toys and scooters for a month at a time.

item.title: How President Trump is changing presidential pardons
item.description: NPR's Mara Liasson explains how President Trump is transforming the power of presidential pardons.
